etymology.description: 䒑(䒑) (cǎo, "grass") + 尞(尞) (liáo, phonetic) = phonetic component for words related to burning or fire
etymology.interpretation: The character 尞(liáo) combines the grass radical 䒑(䒑) to connect to concepts related to burning or fire, with 尞(láo) as the phonetic component to guide pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 他在古文中遇见尞这个字(他在古文中遇見尞這個字)，拼读为liáo且含义独特(拼讀為liáo且含義獨特)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gǔwén zhōng yùjiàn liáo zhège zì, pīn dú wéi liáo qiě hányì dú tè.
examples.english: He encountered the character 尞 in classical texts, which is pronounced liáo and has a unique connotation.

examples.chinese: 尞字在古籍中常作为音旁使用(尞字在古籍中常作為音旁使用)。
examples.pinyin: Liáo zì zài gǔjí zhōng cháng zuòwéi yīn páng shǐyòng.
examples.english: The character 尞 is often used as a phonetic component in ancient texts.
